item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Some people turn sad awfully young. No special reason, it seems, but they seem almost to be born that way. They bruise easier, tire faster, cry quicker, remember longer and, as I say, get sadder younger than anyone else in the world. I know, for I'm one of them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "A good night sleep, or a ten minute bawl, or a pint of chocolate ice cream, or all three together, is good medicine." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Bees do have a smell, you know, and if they don't they should, for their feet are dusted with spices from a million flowers." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "My gosh, if you’re going away, we got a million things to talk about! All the things we would’ve talked about next month, the month after! Praying mantises, zeppelins, acrobats, sword swallowers!" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Every time you take a step, even when you don't want to. . . . When it hurts, when it means you rub chins with death, or even if it means dying, that's good. Anything that moves ahead, wins. No chess game was ever won by the player who sat for a lifetime thinking over his next move." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love" -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Perhaps this is what the stories meant when they called somebody heartsick. Your heart and your stomach and your whole insides felt empty and hollow and aching." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "If I knew that today would be the last time I’d see you, I would hug you tight and pray the Lord be the keeper of your soul. If I knew that this would be the last time you pass through this door, I’d embrace you, kiss you, and call you back for one more. If I knew that this would be the last time I would hear your voice, I’d take hold of each word to be able to hear it over and over again. If I knew this is the last time I see you, I’d tell you I love you, and would not just assume foolishly you know it already." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "nothing in this world was more difficult than love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Tell him yes. Even if you are dying of fear, even if you are sorry later, because whatever you do, you will be sorry all the rest of your life if you say no." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "It takes a lot of rehearsing for a man to be himself." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "She cried a little, but only inside, because long ago she had decided she didn't like crying because if you ever started to cry it seemed as if there was so much to cry about you almost couldn't stop, and she didn't like that at all." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "I do not know what makes a writer, but it probably isn't happiness." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "Remember that every man is a variation of yourself" -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "You must not be unkind, especially when it happens that you're right." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "I can't hate for long. It isn't worth it." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "In the time of your life, live—so that in that wondrous time you shall not add to the misery and sorrow of the world, but shall smile to the infinite delight and mystery of it." " -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "What do you mean, what's the matter with him? Nothing's the matter with him, everything's the matter with him, the same as it is with everybody else. He's just fine. He gets overwhelmed now and then, and he doesn't know how to say what he feels or means, so he cries and runs off a little, trying to find out where to go, for God's sake. Where can you go?" -- William Saroyan

item.title: Karina add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "Unless a man has pity he is not truly a man. If a man has not wept at the worlds pain he is only half a man, and there will always be pain in the world, knowing this does not mean that a man shall dispair. A good man will seek to take pain out of things. A foolish man will not even notice it, except in himself, and the poor unfortunate evil man will drive pain deeper into things and spread it about wherever he goes." -- William Saroyan
